channel.title: Resources on Aspect
channel.description: Recent content in Resources on Aspect

item.title: AwsAccount
item.description: The AWS account resource describes the details of the account that a specified resource belongs to. Note: You will not be able to write a policy directly against this type. Properties Name Description Type Id The account identifier specific to the cloud provider AwsAccountIdentifier Type The type of the account, eg: AWS/Azure/GCP String Policy Template This template will give you a quick head start on generating a policy for an AwsAccount:

item.title: AwsEc2Image
item.description: The AMIs, AKIs, and ARIs available to you or all of the images available to you. The images available to you include public images, private images that you own, and private images owned by other AWS accounts for which you have explicit launch permissions. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Architecture The architecture of the image.

item.title: AwsEc2Instance
item.description: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) is a web service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It is designed to make web-scale cloud computing easier for developers. Amazon EC2â€™s simple web service interface allows you to obtain and configure capacity with minimal friction. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Architecture The architecture of the image.

item.title: AwsEc2KeyPair
item.description: A key pair, consisting of a private key and a public key, is a set of security credentials that you use to prove your identity when connecting to an EC2 instance. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Fingerprint If you used CreateKeyPair to create the key pair, this is the SHA-1 digest of the DER encoded private key.

item.title: AwsEc2Snapshot
item.description: Amazon EBS provides the ability to create snapshots (backups) of any EBS volume. A snapshot takes a copy of the EBS volume and places it in Amazon S3, where it is stored redundantly in multiple Availability Zones. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource.

item.title: AwsEc2Volume
item.description: Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Attachments Describes the attachments to an EC2 instances. There may be 0 or more entries in this collection. Collection<VolumeAttachment> AvailabilityZone The Availability Zone for the volume. String Encrypted Indicates whether the volume is encrypted.

item.title: AwsElasticIp
item.description: An Elastic IP address is a static IPv4 address designed for dynamic cloud computing. you can mask the failure of an instance or software by rapidly remapping the address to another instance in your account. Alternatively, you can specify the Elastic IP address in a DNS record for your domain, so that your domain points to your instance. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource.

item.title: AwsInternetGateway
item.description: Internet gateway are horizontally scaled, redundant, and highly available VPC components that allows communication between your VPC and the internet. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Attachments Any VPCs attached to the internet gateway. There may be 0 or more entries in this collection.

item.title: AwsNatGateway
item.description: Network address translation (NAT) gateways enable instances in a private subnet to connect to the internet or other AWS services, but prevent the internet from initiating a connection with those instances. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Addresses Information about the IP addresses and network interface associated with the NAT gateway. There may be 0 or more entries in this collection.

item.title: AwsNetworkInterface
item.description: Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Name The name of the resource. String Region The region in which this resource is located. String Tags The tags that are associated with the resource. Each entry has two properties: Key/Value.

item.title: AwsPrefixList
item.description: Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Name The name of the resource. String Region The region in which this resource is located. String Tags The tags that are associated with the resource. Each entry has two properties: Key/Value.

Each entry has two properties: Key/Value.

item.title: AwsRouteTable
item.description: Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Name The name of the resource. String Region The region in which this resource is located. String Tags The tags that are associated with the resource. Each entry has two properties: Key/Value.

item.title: AwsSecurityGroup
item.description: A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your instance to control inbound and outbound traffic. A security group specifies the actions that are allowed, not the actions that are blocked. Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Description A friendly description of what the security group allows.

item.description: Properties Name Description Type Account The account that is associated with the resource. AwsAccount Arn The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) uniquely identifying an AWS resource. String Name The name of the resource. String Region The region in which this resource is located. String Tags The tags that are associated with the resource. Each entry has two properties: Key/Value.
